name: Exercise Timing (Fasted State)
properties: Exercise at least 6 hours after last meal
benefits: Exercising in a fasted state (at least 6 hours after eating) may have advantages for weight loss and fat burning. This typically means exercising before breakfast, but could also be before a late lunch or before dinner if lunch was early. The timing maximizes metabolic benefits and fat oxidation.
amount: 90 minutes of moderate activity daily, ideally in fasted state (6+ hours after last meal)

quotes: OPTIMIZE EXERCISE TIMING - The Daily Dozen's recommendation for optimum exercise duration for longevity is ninety minutes of moderately intense activity a day, which is also the optimum exercise duration for weight loss. Anytime is good, and the more the better, but there may be an advantage to exercising in a fasted state, at least six hours after your last meal. Typically, this would mean before breakfast
